meanings.definition: to make a harsh, grating noise
meanings.sent1: The old door kept charking whenever it was opened.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate was charking loudly in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The charking sound of the car engine made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The charking of the cicadas filled the summer air with music.
meanings.sent5: The charking of the chainsaw echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: the act of making a harsh, grating noise
meanings.sent1: The constant charking of the machine was annoying.
meanings.sent2: The sudden charking startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The charking of the dog's bark made the neighbors smile.
meanings.sent4: The charking of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The charking of the chalk on the blackboard made my ears hurt.

meanings.definition: characterized by a harsh, grating noise
meanings.sent1: The charking sound of the broken fan was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The old radio emitted a charking noise that was hard to ignore.
meanings.sent3: The charking sound of the squeaky toy amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The charking wind outside made it hard to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The charking thunderstorm filled the sky with dark clouds.
